trans-unit.source: Bad ACL handler method [{0}]. ACL handler methods must have the following signature (may be static or non-static), with no declared exceptions: public aclXXXX(Object, String[])
Could not find ACL handler {0} in statement: "{1}". Available ACL handlers: {2}
Autoinstallation session created but has not yet been used.
Files required for autoinstallation action have been installed.
The system configuration has been modified to begin the autoinstallation upon next boot.
The system has been restarted in order to begin the autoinstallation process.
The system has downloaded the autoinstallation configuration file from @@PRODUCT_NAME@@.
The initial files required for autoinstallation have been downloaded.
The system is downloading the RPMs required to install.
The system has successfully registered with @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ after autoinstalling.

--------------------- Affected Systems List --------------------- This Patch Advisory may apply to the systems listed below. If you know that this patch does not apply to a system listed, it might be possible that the package profile for that server is out of date. In that case you should run 'up2date -p' (RHEL 4 and below) or 'rhn-profile-sync' (SLES, RHEL 5 and above) as root on the system in question to refresh your software profile.
There is 1 affected system registered in 'Overview' (only systems for which you have explicitly enabled Patch Alerts are shown).
There are {0} affected systems registered in 'Overview' (only systems for which you have explicitly enabled Patch Alerts are shown).

Please contact your regional @@VENDOR_NAME@@ Customer Service Representative for information on how to renew your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Certificate.
Thank you for using @@PRODUCT_NAME@@. --the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Team
We're sorry, but the patch could not be found.
The patch requested does not exist. This is most likely if you arrived at this page through bookmarks or some other non-hyperlink.
You do not have permission to view this patch.
You must be an organization administrator for a @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ to delete a user.
You must be an @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ administrator to view this page. Contact your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ administrator to get information on the organizations in this system.
For details on @@PRODUCT_NAME@@, please visit our website .
@@PRODUCT_NAME@@ offers email notifications for when patches relevant to your systems are released, as well as daily emails summarizing the events for your systems.
The scheduling service appears down. Please contact your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ administrator.

If you would like to set up your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ to authenticate against LDAP, kerberos, and other network-based authentication systems, please see the documentation for instructions on how to set up PAM.
The following patches apply to one or more of the systems in this group.
Below is a list of the systems in the {0} group which are affected by this patch.
We're sorry, but the custom key could not be found.
No Patches Relevant to Your Systems
The following patches may currently be applied to this system.
Edit patch here. Required items are marked with a (*).
You may now publish this patch.
You can send an email notification of this patch.
A patch with this advisory name already exists.
A Patch Advisory cannot begin with the letters 'RH'

Choose the Channels which should be associated with this patch below. The number of packages referred to by this patch is displayed after the channel name. If you do not want this patch to apply to a specific channel, unselect it below.
Patch {0} has been successfully assigned to {1} channel.
Patch {0} has been successfully assigned to {1} channels.
Below is the list of packages which you have selected to add to this patch.
Below is the list of packages which you have selected to remove from this patch. Click 'Confirm' to remove them.
The following packages are associated with this patch. To remove packages from this patch, select them, and click 'Remove Packages' below. To add packages to this patch, click 'add' above.
Please confirm that you wish to publish this patch. Publishing this patch will make it available to all of the Channels selected below.
A published patch must belong to at least one channel.
You can send email to the administrators of systems to which this patch applies.
A patch mail update has been scheduled for {1}.

This is the list of available packages. To add packages to this patch, select them and click 'Add Packages'.
The drop-down list below allows you to restrict the set of available packages by channel.

context-group.name: ctx
context-group.context: Combined Patch Update: RHSA-2004:577 - Security Advisory (and 4 more patches)

trans-unit.source: The following patches apply to at least one system to which you have administrative access.
The following patch list represents all patches accessible by your organization.
Below is a list of systems affected by this patch.
You can select one or more systems and apply this patch to them. Only systems with Management system type can be selected.

The following is a list of all users on this @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ (across organizations). Note that you will only have access to modify the details of users that are members of this organization you are currently logged into ({0}), and only if you have organization administrator privileges for this organization.
Advanced Search will return results from the complete set of patches released by @@PRODUCT_NAME@@.

The following patch list represents patches owned by your organization.

Click on a patch's advisory to edit the patch details or the list of packages to which the patch applies.
Are you sure you wish to delete these patches?
Create new patch here. Required items are marked with a (*).
@@PRODUCT_NAME@@ allows you to remotely reboot your systems.
Systems may be locked or unlocked. Locking prevents changes from the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ website.
Schedule patch updates relevant to selected systems
The patches below apply to one or more of your selected systems.
Below is a list of the systems in the system set manager which are affected by this patch.
The patches below will be applied to listed systems.
Patch updates have been added to the Action Chain {1}.

Are you sure you would like to remove the "@@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Administrator" role from your own login? You will need to contact another @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ administrator to regain this role if you choose to remove it now. You will no longer have access to the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ configuration tools and organization management tools if you choose to remove this role from your login.
Confirm removing the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ administration role from {0} by clicking the button below.
Are you sure you wish to delete this patch?

The following patch list represents patches which may be cloned by your organization.

Only patches which are potentially applicable to one of your channels can be cloned. A patch is potentially applicable to a channel if that channel was cloned from a channel to which the patch applies.

Select the patches you wish to clone, and click 'Clone Patches' to continue.
Show patches which have already been cloned

The patches listed below will be cloned. Once they are cloned, they will appear in your unpublished patches list. From there you can verify the text and associated packages for each patch. Once you are ready, you can publish the patches so they are available to users in your organization.
If you are certain you wish to do this, you may apply the patches as soon as possible, or no earlier than a specified time:

Organizations are a way to place boundaries between sets of systems, system groups, software channels, autoinstallation profiles, activation keys, configuration channels and files, users - everything you manage using @@PRODUCT_NAME@@. Each organization is managed by at least one organization administrator, and the entire @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ is managed by a @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ administrator. The organizations on one @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ with multiple organizations function similarly to the organizations on multiple @@PRODUCT_NAME@@s with one organization.

Create and manage organizations on your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@. You can not view all of the users on the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ here, but you can look up the users with organization administrator privileges in all of the organizations on your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ and you may also assign or take away an organization administrator's @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ administrator privileges.

The following information will be used to generate bootstrap scripts. These bootstrap scripts can be used to configure a client to use this @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ to receive updates. Once the bootstrap scripts have been generated, they will be available from this server.

Please note that some manual configuration of these scripts may still be required. The bootstrap script can be found on the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Server's filesystem here: /srv/www/htdocs/pub/bootstrap
Cobbler sync is used to repair or rebuild the contents /srv/tftpboot or /srv/www/cobbler when manual modification of cobbler has occurred.
Below are the systems in your selected systems list that are autoinstallable using @@PRODUCT_NAME@@.
You may autoinstall the selected systems.
If there is no organization default profile specified for this organization, an autoinstallation will not get scheduled for systems that do not fall under an ip range.
Schedule autoinstall actions for the the selected systems. These actions will re-install the selected systems using the autoinstallation options specified.
Please select the autoinstallation profile you'd like to use to autoinstall the selected systems.
The autoinstallation profile will be automatically selected for each system based upon its network configuration. If no match is found, the organizational default profile will be used if set.

You may choose to use a @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Proxy to access the files necessary for autoinstallation. The selected systems will be registered to the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Proxy selected below after its autoinstallation has completed..
System {0} has an incompatible contact method.

Profiles that are not @@PRODUCT_NAME@@-managed are not guaranteed to register systems to @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ after autoinstallation. You may wish to review these autoinstallations (click on the profile name to do so) to confirm whether or not the selected systems will reappear in the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ system list after autoinstallation.
The autoinstallation file generated by this autoinstallation profile is viewable below:
Due to packages missing from this autoinstallation profile's base channel, the autoinstallation file could not be generated.

Autoinstallation variables can be used to substitute values into autoinstallation profiles. To define a variable simply add 'name=value' to the box below. You would then use $name within the profile to substitute in the value.
There are errors in your kickstart/autoyast template. Please check the '{0}' tab to determine the problem with the template.
There are errors in your kickstart/autoyast template. Please check the error message below.
View a List of Autoinstallation Profiles
The following autoinstallation profiles have been created for use by your organization:
There are no systems currently autoinstalling.
To schedule an autoinstallation, go to the Systems tab above and select the system you would like to autoinstall. From there, go to the system's Provisioning tab and click on the Schedule subtab.
This autoinstallation profile may be edited using the form provided below. Entries marked with an asterisk (*) are required.

Are you sure you want to delete this Autoinstallation?

WARNING: deleting this autoinstallation will remove its corresponding options and scripts.

Please click the button only once; it will take a few moments for the deletion process to complete.

The Organization Default Profile setting can be used with manually-created or bare-metal autoinstallation files. Select this option to indicate which profile in your Organization is used when the URL from this link is specified in the ks=<URL> section of your autoinstallation file. The link will not work unless an Organization Default is specified.

You cannot autoinstall a system registered to @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ using an inactive autoinstallation profile. However, the autoinstallation files for inactive autoinstallation profiles are still available for manual download and may be used for unprovisioned autoinstallations.
No scripts are associated with this autoinstallation profile

In order to autoinstall "unprovisioned systems", you will need to provide them with a boot image that is compatible with the version of the operating system you are autoinstalling to via boot CD.

Once these systems have booted using the appropriate image, you will need to provide an autoinstallation file. You may use the following URL in your Boot CD or in your PXE configuration to provide these systems with the autoinstallation file associated with this autoinstallation profile:
Tip: A full listing of the IP ranges associated with your organization's autoinstallation profiles is available

Alternatively, you may associate each of your autoinstallation profiles with particular ip ranges. Then, you can provide unprovisioned systems with a single URL that will provide each system the autoinstallation file associated with its IP Address. Below you will find this URL:
Associated IP Ranges with Autoinstallation Profile
You may add or delete IP ranges associated with the autoinstallation profile below:
The following IP Address ranges are associated with autoinstallation profiles.

You may wish to modify the following options for special-case kickstart scenarios. We recommend consulting the @@ENTERPRISE_LINUX_NAME@@ System Administration Guide for detailed documentation of all of these options.

NOTE: Changing the Virtualization Type may require changes to the autoinstallation profile's bootloader and partition options, potentially overwriting user customizations. Please visit the Partitioning tab to verify the new settings.

Each autoinstallation file you upload to @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ will need a label so that you can refer to it later - please choose a label for this autoinstallation and enter it below. Entries marked with an asterisk (*) are required.

If you wish to re-use an existing Autoinstallation Profile we recommend you to copy-paste the template from /var/lib/rhn/kickstarts instead of from your browser. This will ensure that the template variables will be preserved and the registration process will work properly after the autoinstallation.

Note: The selection of incompatible activation keys can prevent a system from registering properly after it is kickstarted. You'll want to review the Reference Guide section on using multiple activation keys before making use of this feature.

You can refer to these keys and/or certificates in your kickstart profiles in order to install those keys/certificates on systems during a kickstart. A system will need the correct keys to install signed packages, and correct certificate to be kickstarted by an @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Proxy Server or @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Server. For more information, see the Reference Guide

File preservation lists are lists of files that will be restored to a system during a particular kickstart. You can reference a file preservation list in a kickstart profile. For more information refer to the Reference Guide. The following file preservation lists have been created for use by your organization:

Any files or directories listed here will be preserved following the kickstart. List files or directories one per line.
Each list is limited to a total size of 1 MB. For more information see the Reference Guide.

You can edit the pre and post scripts for this kickstart below. Kickstart pre-scripts are run immediately after a kickstart file has been parsed on a system. You can access the network in this section, but you must use IP addresses (name service has not been configured at this point). For more details on kickstart pre scripts, please refer to the @@ENTERPRISE_LINUX_NAME@@ System Administration Guide.

You can also edit the post script for this kickstart below. First, commands related to @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ will automatically be performed (for example, system registration to @@PRODUCT_NAME@@). Next, the non-chroot post script will be executed, and finally the post script will be executed. For more details on kickstart post scripts, please refer to the @@ENTERPRISE_LINUX_NAME@@ System Administration Guide.

Use autoinstallation snippets to store common blocks of code that can be shared across multiple autoinstallation profiles in @@PRODUCT_NAME@@. When you create an autoinstallation snippet, all autoinstallation profiles including that snippet will be updated accordingly.
Copy and paste the snippet macro into your profiles to make the full snippet appear in that profile.

No relevant security patches.

There are no security patches that apply to your systems. You can view a list of all patches for the software your organization has entitlements to at Patches > All.
If available, an appropriate debuginfo package can be downloaded from the SUSE Customer Center from the respective debuginfo child channel. Note: Not all packages have published debuginfo packages.
The software channels listed below are @@VENDOR_NAME@@ channels or child channels of @@VENDOR_NAME@@ Channels.
The software channels listed below are retired channels that your organization is entitled to but are no longer supported by @@VENDOR_NAME@@ because they have reached their 'end-of-life' date.
Enable debugging in up2date/yum or yast

You may choose to use an @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Proxy to access the files necessary for autoinstallation. This system will be registered to the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Proxy selected below after its autoinstallation has completed.
You can schedule this system for an autoinstallation action. This will re-install this system using the selected autoinstallation options.
You can configure the autoinstallation of this system. This will install this system using the selected autoinstallation options as soon as it boots up.
Please select the autoinstallation profile you'd like to use to autoinstall this system:
Begin autoinstallation at the next system check in.
No profiles currently available for autoinstallation. Please create a new kickstart profile.

Profiles that are not @@PRODUCT_NAME@@-managed are not guaranteed to register systems to @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ after autoinstallation. You may wish to review these autoinstallations (click on the profile name to do so) to confirm whether or not your system will reappear in the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ system list after autoinstallation.

Autoinstallation profiles that are not managed by @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ can not be edited in the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ UI. To modify these profiles, please log onto the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ server and run the 'cobbler profile edit' command. For more information, consult the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Reference Guide.
Please specify a new label for this Autoinstallation Profile. All options, settings and scripts from the source Autoinstallation Profile will be copied to a new Profile except the IP Range Settings.
This is current status of this system's Autoinstallation progress. NOTE: This page refreshes every 15 seconds
Click 'Cancel Autoinstallation' below to cancel this kickstart.
The following autoinstallable distributions are available.

Autoinstallable distributions may be invalid due to a wrong or non existent base path to the kernel or initrd image. To make your custom distribution valid please select the distribution and modify its base path appropriately.

The following details are needed to define an autoinstallable distribution. The tree path field should be a valid path to an installation tree located on this @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ server.

The Distribution Label field should contain only letters, numbers, hyphens, periods, and underscores. It must also be at least 4 characters long.

The Tree Path, Base Channel, and Installer Generation should always match. This generally means that the versions for each field should be from the same version of @@ENTERPRISE_LINUX_NAME@@.

The Tree Path must be a local disk path on your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ server containing the entire autoinstallable tree for a distribution including kernel, initrd, and repo information, but excluding any rpms. This directory should be readable by the apache and tomcat users. If you have media located on the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ server at: /var/distro-trees/sles-11-server/ you would specify that path as your Tree Path value.

NOTE: The Autoinstallable Distribution you have chosen to delete is in use by the following Autoinstallation Profiles. You must change the Distribution used in the profiles below before deleting this Distribution. Click the label in the link to edit the profile's Distribution.
By default virtual guest settings like memory, cpu and storage allocations will be inherited from your autoinstallation profile. If you want to override these settings click on {0} button below.

The following fields may be left blank (in which case default values as defined in the selected autoinstallation profile will be used). Each field may be set individually to override the profile's default value.
No profiles currently available for autoinstalling guests. Please create a new autoinstallation profile with a Virtualization Type other than none.
Below please find complete sets of ISO images for the older releases of {0}. Note that only one set of ISO images is necessary to install any particular release of {0}.
View ISO Images for Older Releases

Below are all the channel content ISOs available for use with channel {0}. If any channel content ISOs appear to be missing below, please ensure that your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Entitlement Certificate has been uploaded to @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ and correctly identifies the target channels.

There are two types of channel content ISOs: Base Channel Content ISOs and Incremental Channel Content ISOs. You will want to download Base Channel Content ISOs if you need to initially populate a new @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ with channel content. Alternatively, you will want to download Incremental Channel Content ISOs if you want to update channels that you have already imported into your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@.
Note: Additional documentation on using @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Channel Content ISOs is available in the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Installation Guide, section 6.2.2.
View Base Channel Content ISOs for @@PRODUCT_NAME@@
View Incremental Channel Content ISOs for @@PRODUCT_NAME@@
Changes to channel assignments will take effect at next highstate application
Changes to channel assignments on salt managed systems will take effect at next highstate application
When subscribing to a channel that contains a product, the product package will automatically be installed on traditionally registered systems or added to the package states on Salt managed systems.

NOTE: These channels are not part of the @@ENTERPRISE_LINUX_NAME@@ subscription for this guest's host, {1}. Subscribing to them will consume additional software entitlements. Applying a different virtual system entitlement to the host system will affect which channels have this mark.

NOTE: These channels are not part of the @@ENTERPRISE_LINUX_NAME@@ subscription for this guest's host. Subscribing to them will consume additional software entitlements. Applying a different virtual system entitlement to the host system will affect which channels have this mark.
Allows various advanced functionality such as autoinstallation and configuration file provisioning.
The following is a list of all system entitlements on this @@PRODUCT_NAME@@, across organizations, and their usage. Click on the entitlement's name for more details about it.

As a Channel Administrator, you may change the base channels your systems are subscribed to. Valid channels are either channels created by your organization, or the default @@VENDOR_NAME@@ base channel for your operating system version and processor type. Systems will be unsubscribed from all channels, and subscribed to their new base channels.

This operation can have a dramatic effect on the packages and patches available to the systems, and should be used with caution.
NOTE: Invalid custom options can cause autoinstallations to fail.
Choose this option if you want to import patches that exist in @@VENDOR_NAME@@ base channels, or child channels of @@VENDOR_NAME@@ provided channels.
No patches found applicable to this channel.
Choose this option if you want to import custom patches or patches from custom channels.
Choose this option to create a patch from scratch. You may import a new patch into this channel at publication time.
Below is a summary of the patches you have selected to clone. Contained in each CSV download is a list of patches and packages respectively that will be pushed to the channel.
Below is a list of patches that can pushed to the current channel. Use the channel selection drop down filter to narrow down patches to choose from.
Below is a list of patches that can pushed to the current channel. Use the drop down filters to narrow down which patches you may choose from.
(Recommended) With this selected only patches that contain packages that apply to this channel are shown. Also, package architecture will match what is currently in the channel.
This is your organizations default autoinstallation profile.
Get started with setting up a @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ server
This document describes SUSE recommended best practices for @@PRODUCT_NAME@@

Below is the list of packages which you have selected to remove from this channel. Removing a package from this channel does not affect the systems which are subscribed to it, or the patches which are applicable to it.

Below is the list of packages which you have selected to add to this channel. Adding a package to this channel does not automatically affect the systems which are subscribed to it, or the patches which are applicable to it.
This channel contains the following patches:
This package is not linked to any patch
Visit suse.com for more information on @@VENDOR_NAME@@ products and services

Tip: sha1 offers the widest compatibility with clients. sha256 offers higher security, but is compatible only with newer clients: Fedora 11 and newer, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and newer or SLES11-SP1 and newer.

Are you sure you wish to delete this channel? Packages in the channel will be removed from the channel, but will remain on the server. You will be given the option to delete them after the channel has been deleted. Patches related to the channel will no longer be related to the channel, and may be orphaned. If the channel has child channels, it cannot be deleted; the child channels must be deleted first. If the channel has autoinstallable distributions associated to it, it cannot be deleted; the distributions must be dissociated from the channel or deleted first.
There are no patches associated with this channel.
Below is the list of patches associated with this channel. To remove a patch from this channel, select it here, and click 'Remove' below.
Click 'Confirm' below to remove these patches from your channel. Related packages will also be removed from the channel.
Successfully removed {0} patch(es) from this channel.

Unfortunately, you have requested information about a package we do not have in our database. Most likely, this is a custom package you have installed by hand, or is from a distribution not supported by @@VENDOR_SERVICE_NAME@@.

The requested autoinstallation file could not be found. If you are requesting an organizational default autoinstallation, ensure that an autoinstallation has been selected as the "Organization Default".
The following patches were cloned from patches that have since been updated. This page will allow you to synchronize your cloned patches to that of its original.
No out of date patches were found.
The following packages will be pushed to this channel as part of the patches sync process. Please review this list and unselect any unwanted packages.
Successfully synchronized {0} patches and pushed {1} packages to channel {2}.
This error may have been caused by an interrupted logout or by logging in from another browser tab. Please contact your SUSE Manager administrator if the problem persists.
A single base type is required for all systems registered to SUSE Manager
Checks whether SUSE Manager certificate has not expired
Are you sure you want to delete the schedule? Associated bunch won't get scheduled any more. This can have a huge impact on SUSE Manager functionality. Proceed only if you know what you're doing.
Current state of the channel (all patches)

The new channel will include all of the latest packages from the target channel, and all patches related to the channel will be cloned into your organization. If your organization already owns a clone of a patch, the new channel will be associated with that patch instead of creating another clone of the patch.
Original state of the channel (no patches)

The new channel will be a clone of the original state of the target channel. This is done by cloning all of the packages from the target channel which do not have a patch associated with them. No patch will be cloned into your organization.

The original state of the target channel will be cloned into the new channel. You will then have the option to select the patches you wish to import into the new channel. Importing a patch will bring the packages from the target channel referred to by the patch into the new channel. Selecting all of the patches from the list of potential patches is the same as cloning the current state of the channel. Selecting none of the patches is the same as cloning the original state of the channel.
Below is the list of the patches which apply to the original channel, but have not yet been cloned into your channel.
You may now wish to clone the patches associated with {0}.
Removed SUSE Manager Administrator role from {0}
Added SUSE Manager Administrator role to {0}
Cannot delete the last remaining SUSE Manager administrator.
Auto Patch Update not available for this system.

To resolve this issue, please check the following things:

  • Is the 'rhn-tools' child software channel for this kickstart profile's base channel available to your organization? If it is not, you will need to request entitlements for the 'rhn-tools' software channel from your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ administrator.
  • Make sure that the 'rhn-tools' child channel for this kickstart profile's base channel is available to your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@. If it is not, please contact your SUSE Manager administrator and request a satellite-sync for the rhn-tools channel and try again.
  • Make sure the spacewalk-koan package corresponding to this kickstart are available in the kickstart's base channel's 'rhn-tools' channel. If not, you will need to make them available for this kickstart profile to function properly.
  • Are the packages listed above available in this kickstart's base channel? If not, you will need to make them available for this kickstart profile to function properly.
Initiate an autoinstallation of a guest system
Schedule a package sync for autoinstallations

Your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ certificate has expired. Please contact @@VENDOR_NAME@@ for a new certificate.
Your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Certificate has expired. Your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ is on day {0} of {1} day restricted period and will soon stop functioning. Please contact SUSE for a new certificate.
Your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ certificate has expired. Please contact @@VENDOR_NAME@@ for a new certificate. Your SUSE Manager will become inactive in {0} day(s).

You are not allowed to perform this action until your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Certificate is renewed. Your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ is on day {0} of the {1} restricted period and will soon stop functioning. Please contact SUSE for a new certificate.

There was an error restarting the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@. It can be manually restarted from the console by issuing the command: /usr/sbin/spacewalk-service restart. Please contact support for more information.
An error occurred and your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ configuration changes could not be stored. Please contact support for more information
No file contents found. Please select a proper key file from your local machine to upload.

Autoinstallable distribution is invalid due to a wrong or non existent base path to the kernel or initrd image. To make your custom distribution valid please select the distribution and modify its base path appropriately.
Autoinstallation cloned successfully. You are now editing the cloned Autoinstallation.
System record created for {0} in Cobbler. This will allow you to autoinstall this system using the {1} profile from {0}'s terminal with the usage of the 'koan' command.
System Autoinstallation scheduled for {0}. Please check the system console for status information.
No profiles found that are compatible with this System. Either you haven't created any Autoinstallation Profiles or this system does not have a Base Channel.

The autoinstallable tree could not be found. You may not have access to the requested tree.

You have selected a distribution or autoinstallable tree that is incompatible with the currently selected virtualization type. Please either select a different distribution, or change the selected Virtualization Type of this profile before trying to set the distribution.

The following is a list of errors gathered while @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ attempts to synchronize autoinstallable distributions from @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ to Cobbler. These errors must be corrected for the distributions to be available for autoinstalling systems:
{0}
Please check:
/var/log/rhn/rhn_taskomatic_daemon.log and /var/log/rhn/rhn_web_ui.log /var/log/cobbler/cobbler.log
for more detailed errors. If you don't resolve the errors the autoinstallable tree will not be usable for autoinstalling.

@@PRODUCT_NAME@@ is an open source (GPLv2) Linux systems management solution.

For details on @@PRODUCT_NAME@@, please visit our web-site at http://www.uyuni-project.org/.

This software is a modular operating system comprised of numerous components that may be accompanied by separate license terms. The software is a collective work of SUSE; although SUSE does not own the copyright to every component of the software, SUSE owns the collective work copyright for the software.

This SUSE product includes materials licensed to SUSE under the GNU General Public License (GPL). The GPL requires that SUSE makes available certain source code that corresponds to the GPL-licensed material. The source code is available for download at https://www.suse.com/download-linux/source-code.html. Also, for up to three years from SUSE's distribution of the SUSE product, upon request SUSE will mail a copy of the source code. Requests should be sent by e-mail to sle_source_request@suse.com or as otherwise instructed at https://www.suse.com/download-linux/source-code.html. SUSE may charge a fee to recover its reasonable costs of distribution
Add Or Remove Add-On System Types
Please use the System Types Page to manage your system types.
Caution: this will overwrite or remove all values for this key on selected systems with a Provisioning System Type.
System Types define the set of functionalities available for each system in @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ such as the ability of installing software or creating guest virtual machines.

A list of your profiled systems follows, with their base and add-on system types shown in the appropriate columns. To change system types, select the systems you wish to modify, and choose the appropriate action below.
One or more of the selected systems lack the {0} system type.
Syncing the packages to the list above is not available for this system.
Create and manage organizations on your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@.
You may rollback rollback-capable selected systems to a previous system snapshot marked with a tag.

You can associate one or more activation keys with this kickstart profile. Activation keys will allow systems kickstarted with this profile to automatically register to @@PRODUCT_NAME@@, gain @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ system types, subscribe to specified software and configuration channels, and subscribe to specified system groups. Activation keys can also specify packages to be installed on a system. Please consider how this may affect your package selection in this profile's Software tab.

Choose "{0}" to allow systems to register to the default SUSE Manager provided channel that corresponds to the installed SUSE Linux version. Instead of the default, you may choose a particular SUSE provided channel or a custom base channel, but if a system using this key is not compatible with the selected channel, it will fall back to its SUSE Manager Default channel.
Deploy configuration files to systems on registration
If the system is registered via Salt, the highstate will be executed on registration if this checkbox is selected.

The systems listed below do not have files managed via @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ configuration management. For systems to be capable of being managed by @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ configuration management, they need to have particular rhncfg-* packages installed. You can enable configuration management on selected systems by using the 'Enable @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Configuration Management' button below.
The systems listed below are capable of being managed by @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ configuration management (meaning they have the required client software installed) but are not subscribed to {0}.

@@PRODUCT_NAME@@ allows administrators to efficiently manage the systems on their network. Through a simple user interface, administrators can perform patch management, updates and maintenance. And because @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ is Web-based, it can be accessed from anywhere. @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ or Proxy server options provide advanced capabilities and the ability to get updates directly from SUSE with even greater levels of security and reduced network bandwidth.
Click here to learn more about @@PRODUCT_NAME@@
Click here to learn more about @@PRODUCT_NAME@@

For Salt minions SUSE Manager will also cleanup any specific configuration installed on the minion. This might take a few extra seconds.

The selected profiles include Salt systems. SUSE Manager can try to remove the specific configuration from the Salt systems. In order for this to work the systems must be up and running and reachable. If a system is not reachable it will result in an error.
Please chose how to handle Salt minions cleanup and delete:
Clean up and delete systems even in case of errors
Only delete systems if cleanup is successful
